Class AdaAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Analyzer
      • AdaAnalyzer

  • public class AdaAnalyzer
extends Analyzer
    The AdaAnalyzer parses Ada files for variable names and scopes, and runs the file against known vulnerabilities.
    Author:
    Abby Beizer, Jamie Tyler Walder

      • isVarName

        public boolean isVarName(java.lang.String s)
        Checks whether a word is an Ada reserved keyword or symbol
        Parameters:
        s - Word to check
        Returns:
        false if the word is a valid variable name

      • extractVariables

        public void extractVariables(java.lang.String file)
        Extracts variables and literals from a file
        Parameters:
        file - The path of the file to be parsed, must be flattened to work

      • flattenCodeAndMap

        public java.lang.String flattenCodeAndMap(java.lang.String file)
        Flattens code and records symbol's lines
        Parameters:
        file - The path of the file to flatten
        Returns:
        a string with no new lines, and with a space separating every symbol

      • getVariables

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,AdaAnalyzer.Variable> getVariables()
        Returns all of the variables in the given file including their line number, scope, type, and assignments
        Returns:
        Map with variable scope as key and variable as value

      • getExternalVariables

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,AdaAnalyzer.Variable> getExternalVariables()
        Returns all of the variables in the given file including their line number, scope, type, and assignments
        Returns:
        Map with variable scope as key and external variable as value

      • getExternalFunctionCalls

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getExternalFunctionCalls()
        returns the list of functions that came from an external source within the current file
        Returns:
        List of strings where the strings are external function names

      • getLiterals

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLiterals()
        returns a list of literals within the current file
        Returns:
        string list of literals within current file

      • getSymbolToLine

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getSymbolToLine()
        returns an a map of the line numbers where each symbol appears. each symbol is an integer. Ex: Line 1 contains symbols 1-15. Used to assign line numbers to variables.
        Returns:
        a Map where the key is the symbol number and the value is the line

      • getSpecialSymbols

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSpecialSymbols()
        returns a Set of special symbols used. Special symbols are: : ; ) ( + - / \\ * \\\ \n \t \r = . \ ,
        Returns:
        A set of all the special symbols used in the current file

      • getKeyWords

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeyWords()
        returns a set of all the keywords used within the current file keywords: abort, else , new, return, abs, elsif, not, reverse, abstract, end, null, accept, entry, select, access, exception, of, separate, aliased, exit, or, subtype , all, others, synchronized, and, for, out, array, function, overriding, tagged, at, task, generic, package, terminate, begin, goto, pragma, then, body, private, type, if, procedure, case, in, protected, until, constant, interface, use, is, raise, declare, range, when, delay, limited, record, while, delta, loop, rem, with, digits, renames, do, mod, requeue, xor
        Returns:
        A set contains all the keywords used within the current file

      • getFileContents

        public java.lang.String getFileContents()
        returns the raw unedited string of the file
        Returns:
        returns the file contents in an unedited string
